welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

parts.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Indian Cuisine Restaurant
  • Home
  • Menu
  • Contact
Welcome to our Indian Cuisine Restaurant

Enjoy authentic flavors of India

Chicken Biryani

Description of Chicken Biryani.

Price: $10

Butter Chicken

Description of Butter Chicken.

Price: $12

Butter Naan

Description of Butter Naan.

Price: $3

Contact us at: example@email.com

Follow us on social media







``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

message.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Indian Cuisine Restaurant
  • Home
  • Menu
  • Contact
Welcome to our Indian Cuisine Restaurant

Enjoy authentic flavors of India

Chicken Biryani

Description of Chicken Biryani.

Price: $10

Butter Chicken

Description of Butter Chicken.

Price: $12

Butter Naan

Description of Butter Naan.

Price: $3

Contact us at: example@email.com

Follow us on social media







``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<marquee>Welcome to our Indian Cuisine Restaurant</marquee>`
Location of error: Inside the `<header>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `marquee` tag is used.
Explanation of Error: The `marquee` tag is deprecated and it creates moving content that cannot be paused, stopped, or hidden, which can be distracting or hard to read for some users.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="sort"></label>`
Location of error: Before the `<select id="sort">` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if labels are empty.
Explanation of Error: The label for the sort select box is empty. Labels should provide descriptive text that helps users understand the purpose of the associated form control.

---

Snippet with error: `<button>Add to Cart</button>`
Location of error: Inside each `.item` div in the `.menu` div
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if interactive elements like buttons have an accessible name.
Explanation of Error: The 'Add to Cart' buttons do not have an accessible name. Screen reader users might not understand the context of the button. Use `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby` to provide an accessible name.

---

Snippet with error: `<input type="radio" id="1" name="fav_number" value="1">`
Location of error: Inside the form in the `<footer>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.1 Parsing (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if id starts with a number.
Explanation of Error: The id of the radio button starts with a number. According to HTML5 specification, id must start with a letter which includes a-z, A-Z, and other characters from a wide range of Unicode characters.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="myfile"></label>`
Location of error: Before the `<input type="file" id="myfile" name="myfile">` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if labels are empty.
Explanation of Error: The label for the file input is empty. Labels should provide descriptive text that helps users understand the purpose of the associated form control.

followups.message: What are some best practices for creating accessible forms in HTML?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Navigation bar WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if there are ways to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple pages. Explanation of Error: There is no 'skip to content' link or similar mechanism that allows users to bypass the navigation bar to access the main content directly. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside each `.item` div in the `.menu` div WCAG Guideline violated: 1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if `alt` attributes provide equivalent information to the image. Explanation of Error: The `alt` attribute for the images only contains the name of the dish. It should provide a more descriptive text that serves the equivalent purpose of the image, such as describing what the dish looks like. --- Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Footer section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if form elements are grouped properly. Explanation of Error: The form elements in the footer are not grouped or labeled properly. Form elements that are related should be grouped using fieldset and legend elements. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the form in the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if checkboxes have associated labels. Explanation of Error: The checkbox for 'Bike' does not have an associated label. All form inputs should have associated labels for better accessibility. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the form in the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if form inputs have instructions. Explanation of Error: The password input field does not provide instructions to the users about the required format or complexity of the password. Providing such instructions can help users understand what is expected.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of the HTML code?

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: `` Location of error: At the start of the HTML document WCAG Guideline violated: 3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if the `lang` attribute in the `html` tag matches the language of the page content. Explanation of Error: The `lang` attribute is set to "en" (English), but if the content of the page is not in English, this would be misleading for screen readers and other assistive technologies. --- Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Navigation bar WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if the purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone. Explanation of Error: The links in the navigation bar have generic names like "Home", "Menu", and "Contact". If these links lead to pages with different contexts, the link text should be more descriptive. --- Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Search field form WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if form elements have instructions. Explanation of Error: The search field does not provide instructions to the users about how to use the search or what kind of search terms are expected. --- Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Menu items WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Check if the structure of the content can be determined programmatically. Explanation of Error: The menu items are contained in a `div` element. Using more semantic HTML elements like `section` or `article` would make it easier for assistive technologies to understand the structure of the content. --- Snippet with error: `
...
` Location of error: Footer section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum) (Level AA) Detection Algorithm: Check if the contrast ratio between text color and background color is at least 4.5:1. Explanation of Error: Although we are not analyzing CSS in this context, it's important to note that the contrast ratio between text color and background color should be checked to ensure it meets the minimum contrast ratio for better readability.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML forms?
